package.name: ip4r93
package.changelog: - Removed unneeded ldconfig calls, per bz review #246747
- Apply 9.0 specific changes to spec file.
- Provide postgresql-ip4r, to match the package name in EPEL.

package.name: postgresql93-debuginfo
package.changelog: - Fix pid file name in init script, so that it is more suitable for multiple postmasters. Per suggestion from Andrew Dunstan. Fixes #92.

- Support separated xlog directory at initdb. Per suggestion from Magnus Hagander. Fixes #90. - Remove hardcoded script names in init script. Fixes #102. - Add support for pg_ctl promote. Per suggestion from Magnus Hagander. Fixes #93. - Set log_line_prefix in default config file to %m. Per suggestion from Magnus. Fixes #91.
- Fix paths in init script. Per repor from Vibhor Kumar.
- Revert #90. Per a report in pgsql-bugs mailing list.
- Update to 9.3.1, per changes described at: http://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.3/static/release-9-3-1.html - Fix issues with init script, per http://wiki.pgrpms.org/ticket/136.

package.name: postgis2_93-debuginfo
package.changelog: - Update to 2.0.2. - Update download URL. - Add deps for JSON-C support.
- Provide postgis, to satisfy OS dependencies. Per #79.

- Update to 2.1.0 beta3 - Support multiple version installation - Split "client" tools into a separate subpackage, per http://wiki.pgrpms.org/ticket/108 - Bump up alternatives version. - Add dependency for mysql-devel, since Fedora / EPEL gdal packages are built with MySQL support, too. (for now). This is needed for raster support. - Push raster support into conditionals, so that we can use similar spec files for RHEL and Fedora. - Add a patch to get rid of dependency hell from gdal. Per http://lists.osgeo.org/pipermail/postgis-devel/2013-June/023605.html and a tweet from Mike Toews.
- Fixed "provides postgis" to avoid self-conflicts - BuildRequires: libxml2-devel
- Update to 2.1.0rc2 - Remove patch0, it is now in upstream.
- Remove ruby bindings, per http://lists.osgeo.org/pipermail/postgis-devel/2013-August/023690.html - Move extension related files under main package, per report from Daryl Herzmann
- Rebuild against gdal 1.9.3, to fix extension related issues. - Enable raster support in EL-6 - Let main package depend on client package. Per pgrpms #141 and per PostgreSQL bug #8463.
- Install postgis-2.0.so file, by compiling it from 2.0 sources. Per lots of complaints to maintainers and pgsql-bugs lists.

package.name: postgis2_93
package.changelog: - Add dependency to hdf5, per report from Guillaume Smet.
- Update to 2.0.2. - Update download URL. - Add deps for JSON-C support.
- Provide postgis, to satisfy OS dependencies. Per #79.

- Update to 2.1.0 beta3 - Support multiple version installation - Split "client" tools into a separate subpackage, per http://wiki.pgrpms.org/ticket/108 - Bump up alternatives version. - Add dependency for mysql-devel, since Fedora / EPEL gdal packages are built with MySQL support, too. (for now). This is needed for raster support. - Push raster support into conditionals, so that we can use similar spec files for RHEL and Fedora. - Add a patch to get rid of dependency hell from gdal. Per http://lists.osgeo.org/pipermail/postgis-devel/2013-June/023605.html and a tweet from Mike Toews.
- Fixed "provides postgis" to avoid self-conflicts - BuildRequires: libxml2-devel
- Update to 2.1.0rc2 - Remove patch0, it is now in upstream.
- Remove ruby bindings, per http://lists.osgeo.org/pipermail/postgis-devel/2013-August/023690.html - Move extension related files under main package, per report from Daryl Herzmann
- Rebuild against gdal 1.9.3, to fix extension related issues. - Enable raster support in EL-6 - Let main package depend on client package. Per pgrpms #141 and per PostgreSQL bug #8463.

- Update to 2.1.0 beta3 - Support multiple version installation - Split "client" tools into a separate subpackage, per http://wiki.pgrpms.org/ticket/108 - Bump up alternatives version. - Add dependency for mysql-devel, since Fedora / EPEL gdal packages are built with MySQL support, too. (for now). This is needed for raster support. - Push raster support into conditionals, so that we can use similar spec files for RHEL and Fedora. - Add a patch to get rid of dependency hell from gdal. - Rebuild against gdal 1.9.3, to fix extension related issues. - Enable raster support in EL-6 - Let main package depend on client package. Per pgrpms #141 and per PostgreSQL bug #8463.
- Install postgis-2.0.so file, by compiling it from 2.0 sources. Per lots of complaints to maintainers and pgsql-bugs lists.

package.name: postgresql93-pltcl
package.changelog: - Fix pid file name in init script, so that it is more suitable for multiple postmasters. Per suggestion from Andrew Dunstan. Fixes #92.

- Support separated xlog directory at initdb. Per suggestion from Magnus Hagander. Fixes #90. - Remove hardcoded script names in init script. Fixes #102. - Add support for pg_ctl promote. Per suggestion from Magnus Hagander. Fixes #93. - Set log_line_prefix in default config file to %m. Per suggestion from Magnus. Fixes #91.
- Fix paths in init script. Per repor from Vibhor Kumar.
- Revert #90. Per a report in pgsql-bugs mailing list.
- Update to 9.3.1, per changes described at: http://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.3/static/release-9-3-1.html - Fix issues with init script, per http://wiki.pgrpms.org/ticket/136.

package.name: pgbouncer-debuginfo
package.changelog: - Update to 1.4.2, for the changes described here: http://pgfoundry.org/frs/shownotes.php?release_id=1863
- Update to 1.5, for the changes described here: http://pgfoundry.org/frs/shownotes.php?release_id=1920 - Trim changelog
- Fix shell of pgbouncer user, to avoid startup errors.
- Update to 1.5.2, per changes described at: http://pgfoundry.org/forum/forum.php?forum_id=1885
- Update to 1.5.3, per changes described at: http://pgfoundry.org/forum/forum.php?forum_id=1981

- Update init script, per #138, which fixes the following. Contributed by Peter: - various legacy code of unknown purpose - no LSB header - used the script name as NAME, making it impossible to copy the script and run two pgbouncers - didn't use provided functions like daemon and killproc - incorrect exit codes when starting already started service and stopping already stopped service (nonstandard condstop action was a partial workaround?) - restart didn't make use of pgbouncer -R option

package.name: postgis2_93-debuginfo
package.changelog: - Provide postgis, to satisfy OS dependencies. Per #79.

- Update to 2.1.0 beta3 - Support multiple version installation - Split "client" tools into a separate subpackage, per http://wiki.pgrpms.org/ticket/108 - Bump up alternatives version. - Add dependency for mysql-devel, since Fedora / EPEL gdal packages are built with MySQL support, too. (for now). This is needed for raster support. - Push raster support into conditionals, so that we can use similar spec files for RHEL and Fedora. - Add a patch to get rid of dependency hell from gdal. Per http://lists.osgeo.org/pipermail/postgis-devel/2013-June/023605.html and a tweet from Mike Toews.
- Fixed "provides postgis" to avoid self-conflicts - BuildRequires: libxml2-devel
- Update to 2.1.0rc2 - Remove patch0, it is now in upstream.
- Remove ruby bindings, per http://lists.osgeo.org/pipermail/postgis-devel/2013-August/023690.html - Move extension related files under main package, per report from Daryl Herzmann
- Rebuild against gdal 1.9.3, to fix extension related issues. - Enable raster support in EL-6 - Let main package depend on client package. Per pgrpms #141 and per PostgreSQL bug #8463.
- Install postgis-2.0.so file, by compiling it from 2.0 sources. Per lots of complaints to maintainers and pgsql-bugs lists.

package.name: gpsbabel
package.changelog: - Update to 1.4.2 - Document how to get source tarball via HTTP POST - Use Fedora's system shapelib instead of gpsbabel's bundled shapelib parts - Use new mktemp based BuildRoot - Build and view gpsbabel.html without network access - Avoid rpm macros for scriptlet commands - Remove x bit also from src files in subdirectories - Add Additional Category to .desktop file: Geography
- Shut up desktop-file-install warnings - Comment the patches in the spec file
- Have this spec file build on f12,f13,f14,f15,el6. (el6 without GUI). - Rename local copy of style3.css - Ship translations for the GUI - Enforce network less doc build with xsltproc --nonet
- Upstream update. - Rebase patches. - Use upstream gpsbabel.desktop. - Address RHBZ 668865. - Fix gzFile pointer abuse. - Install gmapbase.html to /usr/share/gpsbabel.

package.name: skytools-93-modules
package.changelog: - Update to 2.1.11 - Apply fixes for multiple PostgreSQL installation. - Trim changelog
- Update to 3.1 - Re-add mistakenly removed modules subpackage

package.name: postgis2_93-utils
package.changelog: - Add dependency to hdf5, per report from Guillaume Smet.
- Update to 2.0.2. - Update download URL. - Add deps for JSON-C support.
- Provide postgis, to satisfy OS dependencies. Per #79.

- Update to 2.1.0 beta3 - Support multiple version installation - Split "client" tools into a separate subpackage, per http://wiki.pgrpms.org/ticket/108 - Bump up alternatives version. - Add dependency for mysql-devel, since Fedora / EPEL gdal packages are built with MySQL support, too. (for now). This is needed for raster support. - Push raster support into conditionals, so that we can use similar spec files for RHEL and Fedora. - Add a patch to get rid of dependency hell from gdal. Per http://lists.osgeo.org/pipermail/postgis-devel/2013-June/023605.html and a tweet from Mike Toews.
- Fixed "provides postgis" to avoid self-conflicts - BuildRequires: libxml2-devel
- Update to 2.1.0rc2 - Remove patch0, it is now in upstream.
- Remove ruby bindings, per http://lists.osgeo.org/pipermail/postgis-devel/2013-August/023690.html - Move extension related files under main package, per report from Daryl Herzmann
- Rebuild against gdal 1.9.3, to fix extension related issues. - Enable raster support in EL-6 - Let main package depend on client package. Per pgrpms #141 and per PostgreSQL bug #8463.

package.name: tail_n_mail
package.changelog: - Initial RPM packaging for PostgreSQL RPM Repository
- Update to 1.16.5 - Apply a few stylistic fixes. - Update download URL.

package.name: postgresql93-docs
package.changelog: - Fix pid file name in init script, so that it is more suitable for multiple postmasters. Per suggestion from Andrew Dunstan. Fixes #92.

- Support separated xlog directory at initdb. Per suggestion from Magnus Hagander. Fixes #90. - Remove hardcoded script names in init script. Fixes #102. - Add support for pg_ctl promote. Per suggestion from Magnus Hagander. Fixes #93. - Set log_line_prefix in default config file to %m. Per suggestion from Magnus. Fixes #91.
- Fix paths in init script. Per repor from Vibhor Kumar.
- Revert #90. Per a report in pgsql-bugs mailing list.
- Update to 9.3.1, per changes described at: http://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.3/static/release-9-3-1.html - Fix issues with init script, per http://wiki.pgrpms.org/ticket/136.

package.changelog: - Use full path for rpm command. Noted while testing 9.0 live CD.
- Now use http://yum.postgresql.org as the new repo URL.

- Change the package name, and add PostgreSQL major version number. This will let us install the repo RPMs easier. Also, rename RPM key, so that --import won't throw any errors. - Own %{_sysconfdir}/pki/rpm-gpg - Trim changelog
- Fix name of the GPG key file, per report from Rafael Martinez.
